title: Remove transform stack
body:
This stops pretending that I want a transform stack inside ggez itself and makes it easier for people to just write their own external to it.  Hopefully removing a fair few bugs and confusion.  Resolves #369 .

Paging @PsichiX for awareness/review.

title: Remove the docs for pipe in graphics::pipe
Update and draw only on MainEventsCleared.
body:
I think this was left over by some sort of merge mistake? d2a1fe9 moved
state.update() and state.draw() into the MainEventsCleared handler,
where they should be, but somehow they wound up outside again.  Anyway,
this fixes FPS issues in astroblasto on my machine.

The callback passed to event_loop.run() is called with every single event, so anything that's written after the match statement should also get executed with each event.  Code meant to run _after_ the event queue has finished processing should be in the MainEventsCleared handler, assuming I understand the way that the new winit event loop works.

title: Bump rustc version to 1.40
body: This pull request bumps the minimum rustc version to 1.40 as `static_assertions` minimum version of rustc is 1.37 and `cast` requires rustc 1.38 and for `#[cfg(doctest)]` requires rustc 1.40. This should also make the `master` tree go green again!

title: Remove unused imports in examples/
body:
This pull request removes unused imports in `examples/` and removes statements like
```rust
use ggez;
```

As use statement with one path segment do nothing and extern crates is not needed in the latest versions of rust.

title: [Chore] Fixes clippy warnings
body:
This changeset aims to fix a few linting warnings/errors that `clippy` found while analyzing the whole repository. I did not address every warning since some of them might have side effects (like "redundant import" warnings, for example).

I'll be glad to add more changes (or remove some of the commits that go against code specs of the project) if it feels right, either as additional commits to this branch or as a brand new branch.

Please read each commit description to get more insight on the changes made.

title: Allow Custom Gamepads
body:
With the addition of the `GilrsGamepadContext::from()` method, developers can now create any `Gilrs` type, change it to a `GilrsGamepadContext` type, and then do
```ctx.gamepad_context = Box::new(GilrsGamepadContext::from(gilrs));```
to use their custom `Gilrs` type.

The reason this is important is that it allows developers to use Gilrs methods that aren't currently accessible through ggez, like the `add_mappings()` method (see https://docs.rs/gilrs/0.7.4/gilrs/struct.GilrsBuilder.html#method.add_mappings). That specific example allows for custom gamepad mappings to be added in, which most importantly allows developers to read the contents of a file that has been filled with gilrs mapping strings and use them in their ggez project, which makes for easy gamepad setup even if the gamepad isn't automatically supported (automatically supported controllers: https://github.com/gabomdq/gamecontrollerdb/blob/c5992e0edc141be1fd0764c810792b4ead26e25c/gamecontrollerdb.txt) using a program such as this: https://generalarcade.com/gamepadtool/.

title: 02_hello_world.rs
body:
Changed to avoid compilation error because of missing trait:

```console
graphics::draw(ctx, &self.text, (dest_point,))?;
    |         ^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ the trait `std::convert::From<cgmath::point::Point2<f32>>` is not implemented for `mint::vector::Point2<f32>`
```

The help suggested the below action so I choose a compatible (?) type.

```console
T: Into<DrawParam>,
    |        --------------- required by this bound in `ggez::graphics::draw`
    |
    = help: the following implementations were found:
              <mint::vector::Point2<T> as std::convert::From<[T; 2]>>
              <mint::vector::Point2<T> as std::convert::From<mint::vector::Vector2<T>>>
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::convert::Into<mint::vector::Point2<f32>>` for `cgmath::point::Point2<f32>`
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::convert::From<(cgmath::point::Point2<f32>,)>` for `ggez::graphics::drawparam::DrawParam`
    = note: required because of the requirements on the impl of `std::convert::Into<ggez::graphics::drawparam::DrawParam>` for `(cgmath::point::Point2<f32>,)`
```

title: Use ggez::nalgebra instead of nalgebra in examples. Fix #802.
body:
With this, you can turn an example into a crate just by adding `ggez` and `rand` as dependencies.
Otherwise you need to add the same version of `nalgebra` as used by your version of `ggez`.
Proposed by @Kinrany

title: Show a more useful `Debug` string for `filseystem::File`s
Iss640
body:
Fix for issue #640 

Instead of returning a bool, check_update_time() will now return a GameResult<bool>. If called more than MAX_INCREMENTAL_UPDATES times per call to update(), it will return TimeCatchupError, which is a new GameError I added for this purpose. Otherwise, check_update_time() returns Ok(true/false) as it did before. All the examples and documentation should be updated accordingly.

Let me know if there are any issues/changes that you would like me to make

title: Mesh batching and canvas improvements
body:
Hi,

My application involves some distance field rendering on the GPU, which needs a floating point render target. I've added an extra parameter to Canvas::new() function and a bunch of other really minor things.

The other thing is the "MeshBatch" struct that can be used to render instanced geometry, works similarly to the current "SpriteBatch"-es, but tries to cache instance data and only update it when necessary.

Thanks.

title: Faster to_na_matrix (especially in debug)
body:
I noticed most cpu was spent in DrawParam::to_na_matrix when drawing a sprite-batch in debug.

This PR inlines the calculation of the matrix which makes to_na_matrix much faster. 

I left the original matrix multiplication code in there for reference.

title: Reduce crate size
body:
Hi, I saw issue #704 and thought I'd create a PR for it.

I excluded almost all of the `resources` folder from the `[package]` in `Cargo.toml` to reduce the crate size.
I left *'DejaVuSerif.ttf'* alone as removing it broke the `cargo package` build:
https://github.com/ggez/ggez/blob/e3cc91902e8dd993597e27cb81adde16301fcbe9/src/graphics/text.rs#L420-L425


This change reduces the size of **'ggez-0.5.1.crate'** from **946KB** to **380KB**.

title: Implement a `FontCache` type
body:
This type can be useful to measure text efficiently without being tied to the `Context` lifetime.

I use it to compute text boundaries efficiently in [`iced`]: https://github.com/hecrj/iced/blob/master/examples/tour/renderer/text.rs#L16

[`iced`]: https://github.com/hecrj/iced
